Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 1

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Academic Upgrading
Description: Description: This course will prepare students for entry into trades and apprenticeship.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Computer Applications
Description: Description: Students will receive training on computer operating systems (Windows), as well as training on basic word processing and spreadsheets.Hours: 26Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Electrical Safety and Code
Description: Description: This course will review safe working practices and procedures, and hazard awareness relevant to working with electricity. The application, scope, terms, rules, tables, and appendixes of the electrical code book will also be covered.Hours: 28Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Introduction to Electrical Principles
Description: Description: This course will cover the basics of electrical theory, electrical motors, and electrical controls. Topics will include quantities (watts, volts, amps, ohms), circuit characteristics, AC versus DC, magnetism/ electromagnetism, interpretation of schematics and wiring diagrams, trade symbol usage, A/C and D/C motor types, motor parts and components. Hours: 30Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Introduction to Electrical Practices
Description: Description: This course is designed to give students experience building and troubleshooting electrical circuits with an emphasis on safety. The student will develop hands-on skills and be taught best practices when wire cutting, wire stripping, wire termination, installation methods, and using appropriate test equipment. Practical projects will focus on industrial motors and control circuits. Hours: 40Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Employment Strategies and Workplace Exposure
Description: Description: Students will prepare to enter the job market and will be given the opportunity explore a variety of workplaces in this course. Life-long career planning strategies will be the focus including networking, interview and researching skills; developing a personalized resume and cover letter; and understanding current labour market information. They will also develop and enhance skills in teamwork, decision making and goal setting. A variety of workplace tours will be included to increase their knowledge of the trade and industry.Hours: 36Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Trade Calculations

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Introduction to Millwrighting
Description: Description: Students will develop knowledge of safety legislation, lock-out and isolation procedures, protective clothing and equipment, confined space procedures, housekeeping rules, and fire/electrical/chemical hazards. Students will also develop skills in the selection, safe use and care of cutting and non-cutting tools and in the use of measuring devices.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 2

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Drawings And Schematics I
Description: Description: To develop in the apprentice, the ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and schematics.Hours: 32Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Electrical I
Description: Description: This course introduces the student to the basic knowledge of electrical and electronic theory, electrical components and circuits, electrical safety and application.Hours: 16Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Workshop Practice I
Description: Description: This course will develop in the apprentice, knowledge of safety legislation, lock-out and isolation procedures, protective clothing and equipment, confined space procedures, housekeeping rules, fire, electrical and chemical hazards.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Workshop Technology I
Description: Description: This course is to develop in the apprentice knowledge of the principles of cutting and the relationship between speeds and feeds during the various machining operations.Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Machine Technology I
Description: Description: This course is to develop in the apprentice knowledge of ferrous and non-ferrous metals, basic heat treatment procedures, and knowledge and applications of fasteners.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Welding I
Description: Description: This level I course will develop in the apprentice, knowledge and ability to set up and operate oxy-fuel and arc welding equipment to weld, braze, solder and cut safely, and to specifications.

Name: Level 3

Name: Field Placement (Pre-Apprenticeship Millwright and Electrical)
Description: Description: Students will participate in on-the-job training using the apprenticeship training standards for the respective trade.
